content: The Market Clearing Price in the Day Ahead Market (DAM) at ₹4.12/unit during May 2025, declined 22% year-on-year, said IEX in a statement

title: 6 Agra Girls Drown In Yamuna, Were Making Reels On Phone
content: In a tragic incident, six young girls drowned in the Yamuna River in Agra on Tuesday afternoon while bathing to escape the blistering summer heat, officials said.

title: Medical Aspirant, 18, Shoots Self Dead In Madhya Pradesh After Poor Result: Cops
content: A medical aspirant reportedly took his own life upon realising that his exam marks were insufficient to secure admission. The tragic incident occurred in the Maharajpura police station area of Gwalior, Madhya Pradesh.

title: Another YouTuber, With Over A Million Subscribers, Arrested In Spying Case
content: Weeks after the arrest of a travel vlogger in an espionage case, another YouTuber has been arrested from Punjab for allegedly spying for Pakistan as Indian agencies crack down on those leaking sensitive information across the border.

title: World War 2 Bombs Discovered In Germany's Cologne, Thousands Evacuated
content: Thousands of people were being evacuated from central Cologne in western Germany on Wednesday after three American bombs from World War II, each with impact fuses, were discovered during construction work on Monday in Deutz.

title: "Have So Much To Speak As A Tamil": Kamal Haasan Amid Kannada Language Row
content: Actor-politician Kamal Haasan on Wednesday said he has a lot to speak as a Tamil but refrained from making any immediate comment on his "Kannada was born out of Tamil" remark that triggered a massive controversy last week.

title: Opinion: Opinion | This One Is For The Ever-Loyal Virat Kohli
content: It takes a special kind of commitment and faith to continue to believe, to hope, despite season after season of heartbreak and the headlines screaming tales of the team being so close, yet so far.

title: "100 Dead Cats, Skin Peeled Off": Inside Japan Woman's House Of Horror
content: Around 100 dead cats were discovered at the squalid home of a woman in southwest Japan who belonged to an animal welfare group, a local official said

title: 19th Century Condom, With Erotic Image, On Display At Dutch Museum
content: It is neither a painting nor a sculpture. It's a 19th-century condom, made from a sheep's appendix and printed with an erotic image of a nun and three aroused clergymen, now on public display for the first time in Amsterdam.

title: Explained: What Are Rare Earths And Why Has China Stopped The Export
content: Two months after China suspended exports of seven critical rare earth metals and powerful magnets made from them, the ban is posing a serious threat to manufacturing plants in the United States and Europe.

title: Musk's Starlink To Get Licence Soon? What Jyotiraditya Scindia Told NDTV
content: Emphasising that satellite communications is of immense importance in India, Union Communications Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has indicated that the country is eager to welcome players like Elon Musk's Starlink.

title: Indonesian Couple Publicly Flogged 100 Times For Having Sex Outside Marriage
content: Indonesia banned sex outside of marriage in its latest criminal code in 2022 but that law will not come into force until next year. The region started using religious law after it was granted special autonomy in 2001.

title: In Indore Missing Couple Case, Cops Find Out How Husband Was Murdered
content: The Madhya Pradesh man, whose body was recovered from a deep gorge 11 days after he and his wife went missing during their trip to Meghalaya, was allegedly murdered with a machete, police officers said, as the crime sent shockwaves across the state.

title: French President Macron's Waxwork, Stolen From Museum During Protest, Returned
content: Greenpeace activists overnight Tuesday to Wednesday returned a wax figure of President Emmanuel Macron they had stolen from a Paris museum as part of a protest against French economic ties with Russia in the wake of the invasion of Ukraine.

title: COVID-19 In Gujarat: Ahmedabad Sees Fourfold Rise In A Week
content: Gujarat recorded 64 Covid-19 cases in the past 24 hours, bringing the total number of infections to 461.

content: Card networks, mostly headquartered in the West, benefit from historical precedence. Instant payment systems, by contrast, are homegrown innovations in emerging markets, cheaper, faster, and vital for financial inclusion.

content: The accident happened when one of the girls slipped. As they were holding each other’s hands, all of them drowned, police said

content: According to CBI's chargesheet, the candidates directly or through their relatives, sold land to Lalu Prasad at highly discounted rates and that Lalu's family acquired over 1 lakh sq ft of land for only ₹26 lakh as against the circle rate of more than ₹4.39 crore

content: The court passed the directive while allowing a petition filed by the Waqf board challenging the tribunal’s order

content: Mr. Palaniswami cited claims about financial crunch affecting State-run universities in the State, declining student admissions, alleged irregularities, among others

content: Logistics Corporation will be set up to realise goals of road, port, airport, and fishing harbour projects, he says and calls for a plan to build heliports in Agency areas

title: When Kamal Haasan changed his movie’s title after finding no support from Jayalalithaa
content: During a controversy over the movie name Sandiyar, Kamal Haasan tried to meet the then Chief Minister Jayalalithaa hoping to sort out the issue, however, she did not grant him an audience immediately

title: Kishan Reddy demands proper maintenance of streetlights
content: He urged the government to take immediate steps to restore street lighting and ensure CCTV connectivity to help prevent crimes such as chain snatching and eve teasing

title: 34 tourists, family members of army personnel airlifted from Sikkim’s landslide hit Chaten
content: Three army personnel were killed and six soldiers went missing after a landslide hit a military camp at Chaten

title: Ensure flawless arrangements for Yoga Day in Visakhapatnam on June 21, says Naidu
content: The goal is to create a Guinness World Record with the participation of five lakh people, the Chief Minister says, and suggests that two major pre-events be conducted on June 7 and 14 to motivate and ready the participants for the main event

title: Union Minister of State for Defence announces plan to expand NCC by three lakh cadets
content: Several States already extending their concurrence and committing to fast-track the necessary training infrastructure, he says

title: AI cyber fraud: Inside Delhi’s ‘telecaller trap’; fraud kits, dummy a/cs powered racket
content: In Delhi, a sextortion gang led by Jahid allegedly used AI and social media to blackmail vulnerable individuals. Jayshree lured victims, while others impersonated police. Another call center, managed by Ujjawal Pandey and Gaurav Barua, offered fake loans, extracting fees before cutting contact. Telecallers like Akshita, Dimple, and Pinki, under Dilshad Ali, posed as loan representatives, deceiving customers.

title: Honeymooner hacked to death in Meghalaya: What wife’s last call to mom-in-law hinted at
content: Indore honeymooner Raja Raghuvanshi was found murdered in a gorge near Weisawdong falls, Meghalaya, with evidence suggesting he was hacked to death with a machete. Police are investigating the crime, searching for his missing wife, Sonam, and the culprits, while the family demands a CBI probe and Army assistance.

title: Watch: Virat Kohli's curious IPL trophy peek; RCB star checks what's inside
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru won the Indian Premier League after 18 seasons. They defeated Punjab Kings in a thrilling final. Virat Kohli, an iconic player, expressed his joy. He dedicated the win to the fans and the team's resilience. Kohli also shared a heartfelt message on Instagram. He amassed 657 runs this season.

title: 'Parliamentophobia': TMC MP after Centre calls Monsoon Session
content: TMC leader Derek O'Brien accuses the Modi government of "Parliamentophobia" for allegedly avoiding parliamentary scrutiny. This jab follows the INDIA bloc's request for a special session to discuss Operation Sindoor. The opposition emphasizes the need for parliamentary debate on critical national security issues, while the government suggests addressing these concerns during the upcoming Monsoon session.

title: 'Vindictive nature': Imran Khan alleges Asim Munir targeted his wife
content: Imran Khan has accused Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, of a personal vendetta against his wife, Bushra Bibi, stemming from Munir's removal as ISI chief. Khan alleges that Bibi's imprisonment and mistreatment are due to Munir's vindictive nature, further claiming she refused contact after his dismissal.

title: War twist: Ukraine’s drone used my open-source code, says shocked developer;
content: ArduPilot, an open-source software initially created for hobbyist drones, has reportedly been used in a Ukrainian attack that destroyed a portion of Russia's strategic bomber fleet. The software's creators expressed surprise at its military application, as it was originally designed for peaceful purposes like search and rescue and autonomous vehicles.

title: Watch: When 'spy' YouTubers Jyoti Malhotra and Jasbir Singh were together in Pakistan
content: Indian authorities are investigating YouTubers Jyoti Malhotra and Jasbir Singh for alleged espionage linked to Pakistani intelligence. Malhotra, known as "Travel with Jo," is accused of sharing sensitive information and maintaining contact with Pakistani officials via encrypted apps.

title: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis: If I were a student right now, I would study ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis advises students to prioritize STEM subjects and embrace AI tools for future job market success. Speaking at SXSW London, he emphasized the importance of understanding mathematical and scientific fundamentals. Hassabis predicts AI will create valuable jobs for technically skilled individuals, urging students to gain hands-on experience with AI systems.

title: 'Back to...': Kohli’s heart warming message to Salt after RCB’s IPL triumph
content: Phil Salt experienced a whirlwind 48 hours, contributing to Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory and becoming a father. Despite not scoring big in the final, his earlier impact and a crucial catch helped RCB secure the win against Punjab Kings. Virat Kohli celebrated Salt's dual success, highlighting his commitment to both cricket and family as he embraced fatherhood.

title: Canada’s bill will stem the rising number of int'l students seeking asylum
content: Canada's Strong Borders Act aims to bolster border security and curb fraudulent asylum claims, particularly from international students. The bill introduces stricter timelines for asylum applications and enhances information sharing between immigration authorities and other government bodies. These measures respond to rising migration pressures and seek to protect the integrity of Canada's immigration system amid increasing backlogs and policy changes.

title: Anand Mahindra on Carlsen’s reaction after losing to D Gukesh: ‘Wasn’t just a…’
content: D Gukesh, the youngest World Chess Champion, defeated Magnus Carlsen at the Norway Chess tournament, earning praise from Anand Mahindra. Gukesh's composed victory contrasted with Carlsen's frustration, marking a milestone in his career with his first classical win against the world champion. He now stands third in the tournament, closely trailing Carlsen and Caruana.

title: RCB fan dies of heart attack during victory celebrations in Karnataka
content: Manjunath Irappa Kambar, a 28-year-old RCB supporter, tragically died of a heart attack while celebrating the team's IPL victory in Avaradi village. He had organized a large celebration, foregoing sleep and meals to ensure its success. Overwhelmed with joy after RCB's win, he collapsed while dancing, leaving behind his pregnant wife, daughter and grieving family.

title: Drunk dad kills 1-year-old daughter by banging her head on floor for crying
content: In Raigad's Pen taluka, Suresh Dore, a 40-year-old man from an Adivasi hamlet, was arrested for the murder of his one-year-old daughter. Irritated by her crying, Dore fatally injured her by banging her head on the floor.

title: 'Corruption within judiciary impacts public trust': CJI amid Yashwant Varma cash row
content: CJI BR Gavai has voiced concerns over corruption within the judiciary, emphasizing the threat it poses to public trust. His remarks follow allegations against Justice Yashwant Varma. Gavai defended the collegium system, stressing judicial independence. He also cautioned against judges accepting post-retirement positions, citing potential ethical concerns and erosion of public confidence in the judiciary's impartiality and integrity.

title: 'Equally yours, biscotti': Virat Kohli shares IPL trophy with AB de Villiers
content: Royal Challengers Bangalore secured their first IPL title in Ahmedabad. They defeated Punjab Kings by 6 runs in a thrilling final. Virat Kohli dedicated the victory to AB de Villiers. Kohli shared an emotional moment with De Villiers after the win. Kohli acknowledged De Villiers' immense contribution to the franchise. RCB posted 190/9, and Hazlewood's final over sealed the victory.

title: Bummer! RCB's open bus parade celebrations cancelled in Bengaluru; reason revealed
content: Despite the win over Punjab Kings in the IPL final to secure their maiden crown, Royal Challengers Bengaluru will not be allowed to parade their trophy in Bengaluru. A traffic advisory issued by Bengaluru Traffic Police has come as a downer to several fans that were keen to take part in celebrations.

title: How ‘couldn’t let go’ led to DU student’s murder by boyfriend days before her 19th bday
content: Mehak Jain, a bright 19-year-old student, was murdered by her boyfriend, Arshkrit Singh, just days before her birthday. Singh, suspicious and controlling, harassed Jain, even stalking her Korean classes. He created fake social media profiles to monitor her interactions. On Sunday, an argument in a park escalated, leading Singh to attack Jain with petrol and a knife.

title: What is the 'toxic fungus'? Chinese researchers allegedly tried to smuggle into US
content: FBI has charged two Chinese researchers, Yunqing Jian and Zunyong Liu, for smuggling a dangerous fungus into America. The pathogen, Fusarium graminearum, is a potential agroterrorism agent. Jian and Liu allegedly planned to research it at the University of Michigan. This fungus can devastate crops and contaminate grains. US Attorney Gorgon highlights grave national security concerns.

title: NEET PG 2025: Entrance test not before this date of August? What NBEMS told SC
content: The National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS) has informed the Supreme Court that the NEET PG 2025 exam cannot be conducted before August 3 due to logistical challenges. This rescheduling follows the Supreme Court's order to conduct the exam in a single shift, addressing fairness concerns raised about the previous two-shift format. The court is reviewing NBEMS's proposal.

title: How RCB celebrated IPL 2025 title in the dressing room - Watch
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured their first IPL title after 18 years, defeating Punjab Kings in a thrilling final. Director of Cricket Mo Bobat delivered an emotional speech in the dressing room, praising Virat Kohli's dedication and the team's unity. He urged the team to savor the victory and aim for another title next year in Bengaluru, celebrating their hard-fought triumph.

title: Bangladesh revokes 'freedom fighter' status of Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, others
content: Bangladesh's interim government has clarified that Sheikh Mujibur Rahman's freedom fighter status remains unchanged despite amendments to the Jatiya Muktijoddha Council Act. The amendments redefine participants in the independence struggle, recognizing members of the Mujibnagar government as "associates of the Liberation War." This clarification follows recent controversies, including the removal of Rahman's photos from banknotes.

title: Espionage case: After Jyoti, another YouTuber arrested; travelled to Pak thrice
content: Punjab Police's SSOC has exposed a terror-linked espionage network allegedly backed by Pakistan. Jasbir Singh, a YouTuber, is accused of maintaining contact with PIOs suspected of working for Pakistani handlers, including a previously arrested spy and an expelled Pakistani official. Singh's travels to Pakistan and interactions with Pakistani officials are under investigation, with seized devices undergoing forensic analysis.

title: Toxic love kills: 3 young women murdered by possessive partners in Delhi
content: Recent murders of three young women in Delhi, Komal, Vijaylaxmi, and Mehek Jain, highlight the dangers of possessive relationships. Fueled by jealousy and control, the perpetrators allegedly monitored their girlfriends on social media, particularly Instagram. Experts attribute this violence to deep-seated insecurities, unrealistic expectations, and the normalization of toxic behaviors, further exacerbated by social media's influence.

title: Shoaib Ibrahim updates fans that Dipika Kakar's Liver Cancer surgery was successful
content: Dipika Kakar, beloved by fans, underwent surgery for a cancerous liver tumor after a challenging diagnosis. Her husband, Shoaib Ibrahim, shared the news, revealing the 14-hour procedure went well and she's now in the ICU, stable but in pain. He expressed gratitude for the outpouring of love and prayers during this difficult time.

title: 'You've made me wait 18 years': Virat Kohli pens an emotional message
content: The RCB No 18 poured his heart out on Instagram as he recalled what has been 18 years in pursuit of the IPL trophy. He dedicated the win to the loyal Bengaluru fans. The 36-year-old scored 43 in the final and led the charge for his side in what was a thrilling finish to a very competitive season.

title: From tears to triumph: Virat Kohli’s emotional IPL coronation after 18-year wait
content: Virat Kohli’s teary moment at Ahmedabad marked the end of an 18-year IPL title drought for RCB. Battling years of criticism, self-doubt, and heartbreak, Kohli rose like a phoenix to finally achieve his elusive dream. Though a subdued celebration followed, it might just be a start of something special.

title: ‘Thug Life’ early review: Kamal Haasan & Mani Ratnam's film is a 'cult classic'
content: Mani Ratnam and Kamal Haasan reunite after 36 years with 'Thug Life,' featuring music by A.R. Rahman and a stellar cast. Early reviews are positive, calling it a potential cult classic, but controversy arises in Karnataka over Kamal Haasan's past remarks about the Kannada language. Despite the challenges, the film is generating significant buzz and high ticket sales.

title: Watch: Bilawal Bhutto’s remark on Muslims in India hits a wall; reporter invokes Op Sindoor
content: Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari alleged the demonization of Muslims in India at a UN press conference, a claim challenged by a journalist. The journalist pointed out that Muslim military officers, including Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, were involved in briefings regarding India's counter-terror operations following the Pahalgam attack. Operation Sindoor led to cross-border clashes until a ceasefire was established.

title: ITR e-filing 2024-25: ITR-1 & ITR-2 forms enabled online for income tax e-filing;
content: ITR Filing FY 2024-25: The Income Tax Department has enabled online ITR filing for FY 2024-25 (AY 2025-26) via incometax.gov.in, initially supporting ITR-1 and ITR-4 forms. These forms are for individuals with income up to Rs 50 lakh from specific sources.

title: Singer Jessie J diagnosed with breast cancer
content: British pop sensation Jessie J, 37, has revealed her diagnosis of early-stage breast cancer. The 'Who You Are' singer shared the news on Instagram, admitting her initial hesitation. Diagnosed just before her single 'No Secrets' release, she's undergone tests and plans surgery post Summertime Ball.

title: Why gold rate may remain volatile this week & should you sell or buy?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are experiencing a volatile week, consolidating below April's record highs amid geopolitical tensions and fluctuating safe-haven demand. Concerns over US-China trade relations and potential tariff increases added to market uncertainty. Despite dovish signals from the Federal Reserve, rate cut probabilities remain delayed, influencing bullion prices.

title: 6-year-old lured with chocolates, raped inside mosque in Karnataka's Chikkaballapura
content: In Karnataka's Chikkaballapura district, a shocking incident has unfolded where Mefuz, a 55-year-old merchant and father of a cleric, has been arrested. He is accused of raping a six-year-old girl inside a mosque.

title: 'I cannot say Ee Sala Cup Lollipop': Allu Arjun's son following RCB's win
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru won their first IPL title as Allu Arjun's son, Allu Ayaan, celebrated emotionally. He poured water on himself and expressed his love for Virat Kohli and was relieved that he no longer had to use the phrase 'Ee Saala Cup Lollipop'. Virat Kohli too, was overcome with emotion as he got his hands on the trophy after an 18-year wait.

title: ‘1 nation, 1 husband?’: Punjab CM Mann’s sindoor dig sparks BJP outrage
content: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann criticized the BJP's 'Operation Sindoor,' questioning its motives and sparking controversy. The BJP strongly reacted, accusing Mann of mocking a sensitive issue related to terrorism victims. AAP defended Mann, asserting that sindoor is a symbol of marital bliss, not a political tool.

title: ‘I don’t want upma’: 4-year-old Shanku’s viral demand video gets biryani added to anganwadi menu in Kerala
content: Aswathy Ashok posted a video of her son Shanku requesting biryani instead of upma. The video went viral. Kerala's Women and Child Development Minister Veena George noticed it. She promised to consider the request. George kept her word and included egg biryani in the revised anganwadi menu. The new menu also includes pulao.

title: Kamal Haasan’s Thug Life outpaces Akshay Kumar’s Housefull 5 in advance bookings
content: Kamal Haasan's 'Thug Life' is leading in advance bookings, grossing ₹3.42 crore, surpassing Akshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5' which garnered ₹2.15 crore. 'Thug Life' dominates in Tamil Nadu, fueled by Kamal Haasan's comeback and Mani Ratnam's direction. Despite 'Housefull 5' appealing to a broader audience, 'Thug Life' is poised to potentially steal the box office spotlight.

title: 'Anushka, my mum, my brother …': Kohli fights back tears in an emotional interview
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured their first IPL title, defeating Punjab Kings in a thrilling final. Virat Kohli, overwhelmed with emotion, dedicated the victory to his family, especially his wife Anushka Sharma. He acknowledged their unwavering support throughout his 18-year journey with the team. Kohli emphasised his commitment to contributing to the team's success, both on and off the field.

title: Trump admin reverses deportation order of four-year-old child
content: Following widespread condemnation, the Trump administration reversed its decision to revoke the legal status of Sofia Vargas, a four-year-old Mexican girl receiving life-saving treatment in the US. The family, who arrived in 2023, faced deportation after their humanitarian parole was terminated. Doctors warned Sofia would die without continued specialized care.

title: Why China 'turning off tap' may be another Pakistan bluff
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma refuted Pakistani concerns about China cutting off Brahmaputra's water supply, emphasizing the river's rain-fed nature within India. He stated that only a small percentage of the river's flow originates in China, with the majority coming from Indian monsoon rainfall.

title: Rajasthan State employee who was detained earlier arrested for espionage
content: The accused, Shakur Khan, was earlier detained on May 28 and subjected to an intensive interrogation by multiple agencies

title: State, Centre agree to bring Sabari rail project on track
content: Decision taken at a meeting of Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan and Union Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in New Delhi on Tuesday.  An expert committee will visit Kerala in July

title: ‘Power outage in NEET centres did not impact students’ performance’
content: Additional Solicitor General AR.L. Sundaresan tells Justice C. Kumarappan that the test was conducted in broad daylight and hence the candidates were able to mark the OMR sheets properly

title: Cup Namdu!: RCB fans ecstatic as Bengaluru team wins maiden IPL trophy
content: Excitement in the city had begun early in the day with people buying RCB merchandise and organising public screenings

title: Thiruneermalai temple tank cries for maintenance; activists, devotees call for remediation measures
content: The sacred tank of the Sri Rangathaperumal Temple in Thiruneermalai  lacks maintenance, and anti-social activities take place near it, says a devotee; recently, a protest was staged over the poor condition of the tank, and to demand its immediate restoration

title: Prepare for heavy rain, floods in Hyderabad, CM Revanth tells officials
content: Meeting discusses expediting the completion of pending drainage and desilting works, identifying problematic areas and taking preventive measures

title: Three COVID-19 samples from Telangana sent for genome sequencing, all belong to LF.7.9 variant: INSACOG
content: The State, which had zero active cases until a few weeks ago, has now begun sending positive samples for genome sequencing as a precautionary measure

title: Group of over 200 demands Tribal Welfare Department to urgently address violations faced by tribals in Nagarahole
content: The collective submitted the letter in light of the tense situation unfolding at Karadikallu Hattur Kollehaadi, Nagarahole Tiger Reserve, since May 5 after the tribals re-entered the forest ‘to reclaim their ancestral land’

title: Tamil Nadu moves Supreme Court against Madras High Court’s stay on Vice-Chancellor appointment laws
content: The High Court had ordered a stay despite the Supreme Court, in an April 8, 2025 judgment, having invoked its inherent powers under Article 142 of the Constitution to deem that the Bills were assented to by Governor R.N. Ravi.

title: New entrance to Kengeri railway station to ease access and boost commuter safety
content: At present, many commuters cross the trolley path to move between the Metro and railway stations, risking their safety in the absence of a proper connecting route

title: Caglianone, Mauricio and other prospects on the rise
content: 1B Jac Caglianone is slated to make his MLB debut on Tuesday . he hit 15 home runs over 50 games and 228 plate appearances this season . there is a clear path for him to be a top-10 first baseman in fantasy .

title: Injury outlook for 2025: Players to monitor
content: injuries can often be grouped in clusters with the most common accounting for similar absences and return-to-play projections . this year it is the difference in the individual presentations of those injuries that stands out . running back Christian McCaffrey and his Achilles woes were the most unusual after his 2024 season could be considered a total loss .

title: Why the Panthers will win the Stanley Cup (again)
content: a rematch between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers is "an incredible final" he wants to see Connor McDavid rewarded for his 10 years of trying to will the Oilers to their first Stanley Cup since 1990 . he is voted the playoffs' most valuable player moments after losing in the championship finale .
